headline: Warren Buffett Just Give Occidental Petroleum a HUGE $10 Billion Boost. Should You Buy OXY Stock Here?
summary: Buffett’s $9.7B OxyChem deal trims Occidental’s debt, but investors question if losing steady cash flow leaves OXY too oil-dependent.

headline: Netflix, Occidental Petroleum, Bumble: Trending Tickers
summary: Market Domination host Josh Lipton and Yahoo Finance senior reporter Allie Canal track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Netflix (NFLX) facing share pressures this week after Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk called for a boycott over the platform's children's content; HSBC securities and Mizuho analysts both upgrading Occidental Petroleum (OXY) amid Berkshire Hathaway's (BRK-A, BRK-B) deal to acquire OxyChem for $9.7 billion; and shares of dating app Bumble (BMBL) receiving a downgrade. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Market Minute 10-3-25- "Jobs Friday" Cancelled; Stocks, Gold Rise Anyway
summary: Stocks are adding to yesterday’s gains in the early going, while gold and silver are rebounding after a selloff on Thursday. Crude oil is getting closer to trading with a “5”-handle, and the dollar and Treasuries are mostly flat.

headline: Analysts upgrade OXY as OxyChem sale ’unfetters the balance sheet’
summary: Investing.com -- Occidental Petroleum has received upgrades from HSBC and Mizuho after agreeing to sell its OxyChem unit to Berkshire Hathaway for $9.7 billion in cash, a move analysts say strengthens the balance sheet and accelerates shareholder returns.

raw.headline: Analysts upgrade OXY as OxyChem sale ’unfetters the balance sheet’

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Tesla, Applied Materials, Boeing, Rumble, and More
summary: Stock futures were rising Friday, pointing to fresh record highs, as investors continued to shrug off the government shutdown.  Tesla  was rising 1.2% in premarket trading after falling 5.1% on Thursday even as the electric-vehicle maker reported third-quarter deliveries of 497,099 cars, a record for any quarter.  The stock drop Thursday ended a four-session winning streak.

headline: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Comes to the Aid of Occidental Petroleum—Again
